      • scheduleMessage

        public void scheduleMessage(android.content.Context context,
                            CNConversation conversation,
                            java.lang.String message,
                            long time,
                            ScheduleMessageCallback callback)
        Attempt to schedule the given message from the given account, using the default message options specified in MessageDefaultsManager at the given time.
        Parameters:
        context - Calling context. Can be an application context.
        conversation - The conversation the text will belong to.
        message - The actual message to send.
        time - The time the message should be sent.
        callback - Listener to receive results of the call.

      • scheduleMessage

        public void scheduleMessage(android.content.Context context,
                            CNConversation conversation,
                            java.lang.String message,
                            long time,
                            int messageOptions,
                            int expiration,
                            ScheduleMessageCallback callback)
        Attempt to schedule the given message from the given account at the given time.
        Parameters:
        context - Calling context. Can be an application context.
        conversation - The conversation the text will belong to.
        message - The actual message to send.
        time - The time the message should be sent.
        messageOptions - Mask for message options, found in CNMessage. -1 if none.
        expiration - Time (in minutes) the user is able to read the message. -1 if time is unlimited.
        callback - Listener to receive results of the call.

        conversation - The conversation the text will belong to.
        message - The actual message to send.
        callback - Listener to receive results of the call.
        msgType - To store message type

        public void sendMessage(android.content.Context context,
                        CNConversation conversation,
                        java.lang.String message,
                        @Nullable
                        android.net.Uri attachmentUri,
                        SendMessageCallback callback,
                        int msgType)
        Attempt to send the given message from the given account, using the default message options specified in MessageDefaultsManager
        Parameters:

        conversation - The conversation the text will belong to.
        message - The actual message to send.
        attachmentUri - Uri of the file to be attached.

        msgType - To store message type

        callback - Listener to receive results of the call.
        msgType - To store message type

      • start

        public void start(android.content.Context context,
                  CNUser user,
                  CNCashewAccount account,
                  StartMessageQueuesCallback callback)
        Turn on the message queues to allow for sending and receiving of messages. In order to receive messages, users must register an instance of LomentBroadcastReceiver
        Parameters:
        context - Calling context. Can be an application context.
        user - The user that that the queues will be tied too.
        account - The account the user wishes to use
        callback - Listener to receive results of the call.

        Parameters:
        context - Calling context. Can be an application context.
        callback - Listener to receive results of the call.

      • removeMembersFromGroup

        public void removeMembersFromGroup(@NonNull
                                   android.content.Context context,
                                   @NonNull
                                   CNConversation conversation,
                                   @NonNull
                                   java.util.ArrayList<CNContact> members,
                                   @NonNull
                                   RemoveMembersFromGroupCallback callback)
        Remove members from the group. Can also be used to remove the current user from the group, unless that user is the Owner. If they are the owner, they must first change the owner of the group.
        Parameters:
        context - Calling context. Can be an application context.
        conversation - A group CNConversation object.
        members - A list of members to be removed from the group.
        callback - Listener to receive results of the call.
